title:
Effect of molar volume of diffusing elements and cross terms of Onsager
  formalism (vacancy wind effect) on estimated diffusion coefficients in
  ternary and multicomponent solid solutions
abstract:
The correlation between intrinsic and tracer diffusion coefficients
considering the molar volume of the diffusing elements and cross
phenomenological constants of Onsager contributing to the vacancy wind effect
in ternary and multicomponent systems. Manning established this correlation
assuming constant molar volume. The difference in data calculated considering a
constant molar volume and neglecting the vacancy wind effect, which is mainly
practised until today, is compared with the data considering the molar volume
of diffusing elements and vacancy wind effect in NiCoFeCr and an imaginary
quaternary multi-principal element system. This indicates a significant error
in estimated data when considering a constant molar volume if the molar volumes
of the diffusing elements are reasonably different. Therefore, the outcome of
this study is expected to bring a significant change in diffusion analysis in
ternary and multicomponent systems.
